acid.name: Acid
acid.description: Dilute acid for high current generation in diverse power cells.
sources: Blueprint can be awarded by completing a certain stage of Scientific Research mission.
Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

activated_cadmium.name: Activated Cadmium
activated_cadmium.description: A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. This Cadmium has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable. Cadmium is found on planets orbiting red stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.
sources: Mined from large deposits using the Terrain Manipulator. These deposits can be found using the Multi-tool.

activated_copper.name: Activated Copper
activated_copper.description: A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. This Copper has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable. Copper is found on planets orbiting yellow stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.
sources: Activated Copper, similar to Copper, can be found in large deposits on planets orbiting yellow stars. Using the Analysis Visor players are able to locate the resource deposit.
It can also be salvaged from starships at a Starship Outfitting Terminal.

activated_emeril.name: Activated Emeril
activated_emeril.description: A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. This Emeril has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable. Emeril is found on planets orbiting green stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.
sources: Mined from large deposits using the Terrain Manipulator. These deposits can be found using the Multi-tool.
Can be provided by Frigate expeditions.

activated_indium.name: Activated Indium
activated_indium.description: A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Indium is found on planets orbiting blue stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal. This Indium has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.
sources: It can be found on planets orbiting blue stars (typically extreme weather planets). It's easy to spot because of its specific blue color.
Can be returned by Frigate expeditions.

albumen_pearl.name: Albumen Pearl
albumen_pearl.description: Gemstone formed over the course of centuries within the egg of a super-incubatory species. Extremely rare.
sources: Albumen Pearls are most reliably sourced in cave systems beneath a planet's surface, inside red shells called Humming Sacs. Taking these will not alarm the Sentinels.

On certain planets, they can be found everywhere on the surface inside large pea pod-shaped plants similar to Albumen Pearl Orbs but labelled as Sentient Plants by the Analysis Visor. While these planets usually have a high environmental hazard, this is not always the case. Taking Albumen Pearls from these plants will alarm the Sentinels.
With assistance from a Farmer, Albumen Pearls can also be grown as a product of the Albumen Pearl Orb plant, with a harvest time of 2 hours.

albumen_pearl_orb.name: Albumen Pearl Orb
albumen_pearl_orb.description: A medium-sized, farmable Crystal Orb that yields an occasional harvest of valuable Albumen Pearls. Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Cannot be planted outdoors. Approximate growing time: 2 hours

anomaly_detector.name: Anomaly Detector
anomaly_detector.description: A single-use geometric beacon that probes the surrounding area for near-space anomalies. Such objects are highly unpredictable. Select the Detector and use Begin Scan to begin the location process.
sources: Occasionally received on shooting Asteroids.

antimatter.name: Antimatter
antimatter.description: Contained negative matter and baryogenesis antiparticles. The vast energy potential of antimatter makes it highly valuable. 95% of existing antimatter consumption is in the powering of starship hyperdrives. WARNING: uncontained usage is not recommended.
sources: Can be automatically harvested by Antimatter Reactor.
Can be found in Cargo Drops or Barrel Fabricators.
Can sometimes be bought at Galactic Trade Terminals or from NPCs.

antimatter_housing.name: Antimatter Housing
antimatter_housing.description: Secure antimatter containment device, required before Antimatter can be safely secured as Warp Cells. Rebound Oxygen forms a protective gas pocket, preventing the antimatter from reacting with the surrounding casing.
sources: Antimatter Housing can be purchased at Galactic Trade Terminals.

aronium.name: Aronium
aronium.description: A lightweight and highly malleable alloy. Crafted from Paraffinium and Chlorine. In high demand on the Galactic Trade Network due to its utility in the construction of planetside outposts and facilities.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.
Can be received after analysing Glowing Mineral.

basalt.name: Basalt
basalt.description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an Analysis Visor. Typically found on planets with a volcanic environment.
sources: In resource deposits on Volcanic planets, though not all eligible planets will present deposits.
As a secondary element in some Minerals on Volcanic planets.

cactus_flesh.name: Cactus Flesh
cactus_flesh.description: Succulent, edible cactus flesh from the Echinocactus plant. As well as being juicy on the tongue, the flesh has many industrial uses. The Echinocactus thrives only on desert planets, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.
sources: As described in the Game description, this element can be recovered from specific Echinocactus plants in desert/barren biomes.
It can also be found mixed with carbon in carbon-based plants or trees. For easy discovery, scan these flora with your visor and see what elements are in them.
It should be noted that the spawn rate for the "classic" Echinocactus plants is really low and is easier to find the element mixed with other flora found on barren planets.
With assistance from a Farmer, Cactus Flesh can also be grown as a product of the Echinocactus plant, with a harvest time of 16 hours and a yield of 100.

cadmium.name: Cadmium
cadmium.description: A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets. Cadmium is found on planets orbiting red stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
sources: In resource deposits on planets orbiting red stars.
Dismantling Pulse Engine Upgrade modules.

captured_nanode.name: Captured Nanode
captured_nanode.description: Atlas Seed containing zonally-shifted quasi-stellar substrate. Warning: do not allow matrix to commune with this dimensional space.
sources: The blueprint is given after talking to an Atlas Interface. Milestone Pathfinder or above is required.

carbon.name: Carbon
carbon.description: The building block of all organic life. Of critical importance to space travelers, as Carbon is used to recharge mining equipment. The Mining Laser will harvest Carbon from trees, plants, and all other forms of vegetation.
sources: Can be mined from flora.
It can be found as a secondary element in some minerals.

carbon_nanotubes.name: Carbon Nanotubes
carbon_nanotubes.description: Metres and metres of high capacity carbon nanotubes. Their high tensile strength and mild conductivity make these a key component in many advanced technologies.
sources: Available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

chewy_wires.name: Chewy Wires
chewy_wires.description: This odd collection of wires pulses with a faint, almost organic energy. It seems to remember the whole from which it was parted... Process in a Nutrient Processor to generate 'edible' products.
sources: This ingredient can be sourced by gathering from robotic creatures (Mechanoceris) when fed Ion Batteries.

chlorine.name: Chlorine
chlorine.description: A reactive element most easily harvested by processing the salt-infused minerals found in oceans. Used in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
sources: Created via further refining (detailed below)
Labeled as 'Organic' Rock when using your Analysis Visor
Found in large underwater Mineral formations that require an Advanced Mining Laser to harvest.
From some Galactic Trade Terminals.

chromatic_metal.name: Chromatic Metal
chromatic_metal.description: A processed metal alloy, created in a Refiner from the stellar metals: Copper, Cadmium, Emeril and Indium. The rarer the stellar metal, the more Chromatic Metal it will produce. This valuable metal is used in the creation of many advanced technologies.
sources: Available for purchase from some Galactic Trade Terminals.
Can be requested from freighter's captain for rescuing his Freighter from pirates, up to 256 Chromatic Metal.
Drops from destroyed Pirate ships and NPC ships (standing will decrease) in small amounts, 30-50 Chromatic Metal per ship destroyed.
Drops from Freighter cargo pods (Sentinels will attack back) or accompanying free floating cargo pods (standing will decrease), 200-250 Chromatic Metal per pod destroyed.

circuit_board.name: Circuit Board
circuit_board.description: Stackable, semi-flexible circuit board made from a highly durable synthetic polymer.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

cobalt.name: Cobalt
cobalt.description: Mined from underground minerals, cobalt is found in plentiful supply in caves and caverns. Useful in the manufacture of Ion Batteries. It is used in the creation of several technologies and structures, and can be processed in a Refiner to make the most of its inherent charge.
sources: From any Galactic Trade Terminal.
As a primary element in stalagtite and stalagmite minerals found in caves.
In resource deposits.

condensed_carbon.name: Condensed Carbon
condensed_carbon.description: Advanced material, processed from regular carbon in a Refiner. The increased molecule density offers a substantially improved energy-per-gram ratio. Occasionally found in crystalline form. Harvesting large crystals may require an Advanced Mining Laser.
sources: In crystal minerals located on nearly every planet. The larger minerals require an Advanced Mining Laser. These are visible on the Scanner.

convergence_cube.name: Convergence Cube
convergence_cube.description: Device used by the Korvax for the storage of historical and cultural information.
sources: It can be found in Damaged Containers or as monolith rewards.
It can be purchased from NPCs at Trading Posts.
It is a possible reward from frigate expeditions.
It is a possible trade from wandering traders you encounter while using the Pulse Engine.
It can be given by a Korvax space station exploration guild envoy, if you have a sufficient exploration guild rank.
It can be sold by landed NPC pilots.

copper.name: Copper
copper.description: A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets. Copper is found on planets orbiting yellow stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
sources: Resource Deposits and Hotspots on planets orbiting yellow stars.
Galactic Trade Terminals.
Secondary element in cave minerals (rare).
A Terrain Manipulator or Autonomous Mining Units are needed to mine copper deposits. A Mineral Extractor is required to harvest copper located using the Survey Device upgrade to the Analysis Visor.

cryo_pump.name: Cryo-Pump
cryo_pump.description: An advanced, self-regulating hybrid material, the Cryo-Pump distributes heat across itself with near perfect efficiency, making it vital in the creation of thermal regulators.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Can be obtained as a mission reward.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.

cryogenic_chamber.name: Cryogenic Chamber
cryogenic_chamber.description: A low temperature chamber, designed to prevent the natural decay of organic matter.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

crystal_fragment.name: Crystal Fragment
crystal_fragment.description: A crystalline shard with an unusually dense structure. Potentially highly valuable.
sources: It can be acquired from Di-hydrogen Crystals, indicated with "H" when the Scanner is used.

crystal_sulphide.name: Crystal Sulphide
crystal_sulphide.description: Formed in the incredible, high-pressure furnace of planetary cores, these rich mineral deposits have an almost glass-like quality. Has a wide variety of industrial uses, taking advantage of both its mineral content and its extreme strength under pressure.
sources: Can be obtained from the sides of underwater vents. Use caution when harvesting, as the vent may trigger a blast of super-heated water which may cause damage to the harvester.

cursed_dust.name: Cursed Dust
cursed_dust.description: A powdery desert soil, slick with the gland expressions of a colossal sandworm. Historically, some have regarded this dust as the divine parent of such worms. It smells curiously sweet. Cursed Dust gathers in the terrain deposits of planets blighted by titan worm activity.
sources: Obtained as a mission reward from the Bounty Master at an Outlaw station.

cyto_phosphate.name: Cyto-Phosphate
cyto_phosphate.description: A blue-green organic compound produced during the metabolic cycle of deep-sea plantlife. Rich in soluble energy, cyto-phosphates are crucial in many submarine technologies. The Mining Laser will harvest cyto-phosphate compounds from underwater flora.
sources: It can be mined from various underwater flora, but be aware as this mining process may spawn Abyssal Horrors.

dark_matter.name: Dark Matter
dark_matter.description: An Atlas Seed shell encompassing a void element harvested from the collapse state of the last universe. Toxic if ingested.
sources: The blueprint is given after talking to an Atlas Interface. Milestone Cassini or above is required.

dawns_end.name: Dawn's End
dawns_end.description: Sculpted tau neutrino-boson matrix fixed within an irreplaceable Atlas Seed shell. May be semi-sentient.
sources: The blueprint is given after talking to an Atlas Interface. Milestone Kepler or above is required.

deuterium.name: Deuterium
deuterium.description: A stable hydrogen isotope used heavily in both small-scale fusion reactors and neutron-scattering shield technology. Deuterium very rarely occurs naturally. Most of the galaxy's supply comes from the processing of Di-hydrogen and Tritium in Refiners.
sources: Can be purchased from terminals or NPCs.
Can be obtained by dismantling Deuterium-based technology.

di_hydrogen.name: Di-hydrogen
di_hydrogen.description: A stable, crystalline form of hydrogen remarkable both for its extreme energy density and its stability at atmospheric pressures. Common to all worlds, Di-hydrogen is found in the form of large blue crystals. It is a key component of Starship Launch Fuel.
sources: Di-hydrogen can be found in blue crystal minerals located on nearly every planet. The larger minerals require an Advanced Mining Laser.

di_hydrogen_jelly.name: Di-hydrogen Jelly
di_hydrogen_jelly.description: A faintly-glowing jelly. Its gentle light and soft wobble belie the fact that this sticky gel is both highly toxic and highly flammable. Skin contact is to be avoided at all costs. Synthesised from Di-hydrogen.
sources: Available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

dioxite.name: Dioxite
dioxite.description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an Analysis Visor. Typically found on planets with a frozen environment.
sources: As a secondary element in some minerals or in Resource Deposits or Hotspots on planets with Frozen biomes.
Found in Hotspots on Mega Exotic planets located in blue stellar systems.
Also available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

dirty_bronze.name: Dirty Bronze
dirty_bronze.description: A popular metal alloy with a wide variety of uses. 'Dirty Bronze' has shed its scientific name in favor of the popular term for its colour.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.
Can be received after analysing Glowing Mineral

divergence_cube.name: Divergence Cube
divergence_cube.description: A glitching, pulsing data unit. It does not seem to belong in this reality. The cube gives the impression of a silent scream, the frozen cries of hundreds of lost minds trapped within.
sources: A quest item which can be received at plaques.

echinocactus.name: Echinocactus
echinocactus.description: Native to barren biomes and capable of withstanding long periods of drought, Echinocactus is an edible succulent that responds well to cultivation, yielding a large but occasional harvest. Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Ensure Barren climate before planting outdoors. Approximate growing time: 16 hours

emergency_broadcast_receiver.name: Emergency Broadcast Receiver
emergency_broadcast_receiver.description: A single-use receiver that scans for distress signals on freighter frequencies. Derelict or abandoned freighters often contain high-value salvage. Select the Receiver and use Tune Signal to begin the location process.
sources: Can be purchased from the Scrap Dealer aboard the Space Station.
Can be received as a reward from Nexus missions.
Iteration Helios offers a free receiver each week. Travellers must complete a derelict freighter mission before Helios will start offering a free receiver.

emeril.name: Emeril
emeril.description: A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Emeril is found on planets orbiting green stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
sources: Emeril can be found on the surfaces of planets in green star systems.
It can be mined with the Terrain Manipulator attachment for the Multi-tool.
It can also be collected by feeding the fauna on certain planets. After a short period of time, they may dig some up or generate the element by various bodily functions.

englobed_shade.name: Englobed Shade
englobed_shade.description: This Atlas Shell holds the remains of a parasitic space-borne lifeform, most likely of extra-dimensional origins.
sources: The blueprint is given after talking to an Atlas Interface. Milestone Juno or above is required.

enriched_carbon.name: Enriched Carbon
enriched_carbon.description: A refined product, taking ordinary carbon and boosting it with radioactive energy.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
It can be found at Resource Depots.
It can also be obtained as a mission reward.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.

explosive_drones.name: Explosive Drones
explosive_drones.description: A temporary frigate upgrade that lasts for one expedition. This pack of autonomous explosives have been programmed to launch from the fleet and pilot themselves directly towards hostile vessels. Extremely dangerous.
sources: The product's blueprint is a possible reward from a Manufacturing Facility or Operations Centre.
The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for one Salvaged Frigate Module.
A possible drop from Sentinel starships.

faecium.name: Faecium
faecium.description: A foul-smelling compound that can be harvested from the Gutrot Flower, or less desirably from the faecal matter of some species. Creatures can be fed to encourage the formation and deposition of faecium crystals.
sources: This resource can be obtained by feeding creatures on planets and then collecting their dropped coprite crystals. This process can be rather slow, however.
With assistance from a Farmer, Faecium can also be grown as a product of the Gutrot Flower, yielding a base product of 25 with a harvest time of 4 hours.
It can also be found on some planets as a by-product of some carbon-based plants much like some gases.
Sometimes it can be found in resource deposits on marsh planets.

ferrite_dust.name: Ferrite Dust
ferrite_dust.description: An abundant mineral element, found in rock formations and other areas of geological interest. Easily extracted using a Mining Laser. Typically requires processing in a Refiner before use in construction or technology manufacture.
sources: As a primary element in most minerals.
From any Galactic Trade Terminal.

frigate_fuel_50_tonnes.name: Frigate Fuel (50 Tonnes)
frigate_fuel_50_tonnes.description: A small barrel of frigate fuel. This viscous gel is highly toxic to the touch. A refined fuel, it powers the interstellar engines of large trading ships.
sources: The blueprint is a reward given during the Freighter Command mission.

frigate_fuel_100_tonnes.name: Frigate Fuel (100 Tonnes)
frigate_fuel_100_tonnes.description: A large barrel of frigate fuel. This viscous gel is highly toxic to the touch. A refined fuel, it powers the interstellar engines of large trading ships.
sources: The blueprint is a reward given during the Freighter Command mission.

frigate_fuel_200_tonnes.name: Frigate Fuel (200 Tonnes)
frigate_fuel_200_tonnes.description: A huge barrel of frigate fuel. This viscous gel is highly toxic to the touch. A refined fuel, it powers the interstellar engines of large trading ships.
sources: The blueprint is a reward given during the Freighter Command mission.

frost_crystal.name: Frost Crystal
frost_crystal.description: A beautiful blue crystal, this organic compound possesses both great hardiness and a shimmering translucence. It is harvested from the leaves of Frostwort. Frostwort requires frozen conditions to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.
sources: This element can be harvested from wild plants, but requires the use of Haz-Mat Gauntlet.
With assistance from a Farmer, Frost Crystals can also be grown as a product of the Frostwort plant, providing a base yield of 50 with a harvest time of approximately 60 minutes.

frostwort.name: Frostwort
frostwort.description: A large crystal flower with radiant blue blooms, found only in snowy biomes. Frostwort can be farmed and makes a reliable crop, and its adaptation to harsh conditions results in highly frequent harvests. Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Ensure Frozen climate before planting outdoors. Approximate growing time: 1 hour

fungal_cluster.name: Fungal Cluster
fungal_cluster.description: A spherical fungus with internal gills, found only in toxic biomes. Fungal Clusters can be transplanted for cultivation, yielding a bountiful harvest. Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Ensure Toxic climate before planting outdoors. Approximate growing time: 4 hours

fungal_mould.name: Fungal Mould
fungal_mould.description: An oddly-glowing substance, harvested from the gills of Fungal Clusters. The host plant requires a toxic climate to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.
sources: This element can be obtained from specific reddish-brown mushrooms on toxic planets. Safely harvesting this resource requires the use of Haz-Mat Gauntlet.
With assistance from a Farmer, Fungal Mould can also be grown as a product of the Fungal Cluster plant, with a harvest time of 4 hours yielding 50 Fungal Mould.

fuel_oxidiser.name: Fuel Oxidiser
fuel_oxidiser.description: A temporary frigate upgrade that lasts for one expedition. This powerful fuel upgrade overloads frigate engines, allowing for faster-than-usual travel.
sources: The product's blueprint is a possible reward from a Manufacturing Facility or Operations Centre.
The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for one Salvaged Frigate Module.

fusion_accelerant.name: Fusion Accelerant
fusion_accelerant.description: An advanced fuel source, made from a perfect blend of high potential energy organic materials.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Can be obtained as a mission reward.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.

fusion_ignitor.name: Fusion Ignitor
fusion_ignitor.description: A highly advanced piece of technology for use in the next generation of power plants. Producing a fusion core requires both intricate scientific skills and complex industrial processes.
sources: The blueprint can be acquired from Manufacturing Facilites or purchased from the Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

gamma_root.name: Gamma Root
gamma_root.description: A strange substance that seems to slowly shift the air around it. It is found in the roots of the Gamma Weed plant. Gamma Weed requires high background radiation to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.
sources: This element can be harvested from wild plants, but requires the use of Haz-Mat Gauntlet.
With assistance from a Farmer, it can also be grown as a product of the Gamma Weed plant, yielding 50 with a harvest time of 4 hours.

gamma_weed.name: Gamma Weed
gamma_weed.description: A luminous, leafy flowering plant that thrives in radioactive biomes and can be cultivated to yield a bountiful harvest. Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Ensure Radioactive climate before planting outdoors. Approximate growing time: 4 hours

gek_relic.name: Gek Relic
gek_relic.description: A metal statuette of a creature with a coin placed in its beak. Popular with many traders who see it as an emblem of fair commerce and peace.
sources: It can be found in Damaged Containers or as monolith rewards.
It can be rewarded from Gek NPC on Minor Settlements.
It can also be bought from NPCs in Trading Posts.
It is a possible reward from frigate expeditions.
It is also a possible trade from wandering traders you encounter while using the Pulse Engine.

geknip.name: GekNip
geknip.description: Edible product much beloved by the Gek. Allows beaked traders to release delightfully scented packets of gas for a prolonged period of time. GekNip gas packets are considered an art form, and the truest representation of the Gek soul.
sources: It can be found in Damaged Containers or as monolith rewards.
It can also be bought from NPCs in Trading Posts.
It is a possible reward from frigate expeditions.
It is also a possible trade from wandering traders you encounter while using the Pulse Engine.
It is a possible reward from Practice Language with Geks.

geode.name: Geode
geode.description: An unusually vibrant and potentially valuable lump of rock.
sources: Rarely found from completely mining surface minerals.

geodesite.name: Geodesite
geodesite.description: Advanced and durable alloy primarily used in starship hull construction and deep-space exploration drone technology.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.
Can be received after analysing Glowing Mineral.

glass.name: Glass
glass.description: Shatter-proof, scratch-resistant glass with a self-cleaning, UV-cured coating, for general construction use.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

glowing_mineral.name: Glowing Mineral
glowing_mineral.description: Though its surface is dirtied and dull, polishing this rock reveals a deep inner glow, a glitter beneath a subtly iridescent surface.
sources: One piece each can be harvested from Floating Crystals and from underground Buried Mineral Formations.

gold.name: Gold
gold.description: Highly valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically mined from asteroids. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits. Universally prized for its beauty and versatility.
sources: As a primary (very rare) or secondary element in some minerals in caves.
Can be mined from asteroids.
Can be mined from deposits on Exotic planets.
Acquired as loot dropped by pirates.
Can be found in Metal 'Fingers'.
Can be received from Gold Nuggets after they are analysed.
Also available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

gold_nugget.name: Gold Nugget
gold_nugget.description: A highly valuable ore chunk, ready to be processed into Gold.
sources: Can be mined from asteroids.

grantine.name: Grantine
grantine.description: Soft workable alloy favored by artisans throughout the known galaxy. A popular trading good, with many galactic shipping paths devoted to its sale and transport.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.
Can be received after analysing Glowing Mineral.

gravitino_ball.name: Gravitino Ball
gravitino_ball.description: A supersymmetric particle cluster created by divergent super-gravitational forces. A micro-rift is created as they form, and extraction of the orb prompts a localised reality weakening. Sentinel forces will respond to stablise any such anomaly. Can be sold at a Galactic Trade Terminal.
sources: Gravitino Balls will always spawn on planets with hostile sentinels.
Gravitino Plants on a frozen world.

They can also be found from a rock-like creature with a stalk holding a Gravitino Ball. These are called Sentient Plant in-game. The stalk will only appear when you're near it. This type has a low chance of appearing on planets without extreme weather, and is similar to the Light Stalk found around Xen in the game Half Life.
Several can also be found at certain Ancient Ruins.
With assistance from a Farmer, Gravitino Balls can also be grown as a product of the Gravitino Host plant, with a harvest time of 120 minutes.
Can be found on Frigate expeditions.

gravitino_host.name: Gravitino Host
gravitino_host.description: A strange, potentially parasitic plant that yields an occasional harvest of the highly tradable commodity, Gravitino Balls. Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Cannot be planted outdoors. Approximate growing time: 2 hours

gutrot_flower.name: Gutrot Flower
gutrot_flower.description: A foul-smelling, farmable flower that replicates the chemical structure of faecal matter. When planted inside, yields a harvest of Faecium. A good alternative to collecting Faecium by hand, which requires feeding creatures and then harvesting their droppings. Gutrot Flowers must be grown in a Hydroponics Tray. Approximate growing time: 4 hours

hadal_core.name: Hadal Core
hadal_core.description: A highly-pressurised fleshy orb. One can feel it push back when touched, a flash of bioluminescence stirring in the inky black core of this mysterious object.
sources: Five pieces can be acquired from an Alluring Specimen, but with each harvest there is a chance for an Abyssal Horror to appear, destroying the remaining cores.
Can be found in Derelict Freighter containers.
Can be found in the form of Submerged Relics (one piece).
From Suspicious Packet (Goods).
From Nexus and Mission Board Missions.
As a gift from Planetary Settlement visitors.

heart_of_the_sun.name: Heart of the Sun
heart_of_the_sun.description: An Atlas Seed containing a time-locked quantum cilia suspended in a photonic shell. No others are known to exist.
sources: The blueprint is given after talking to an Atlas Interface. Milestone Magellan or above is required.

heat_capacitor.name: Heat Capacitor
heat_capacitor.description: A thermal regulator produced from refined organic material. It is unique in its ability to produce, dissipate and distribute heat as required.
sources: Blueprint can be awarded by completing a certain stage of Scientific Research mission.
Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
This can be found in a Cargo Drop.

hermetic_seal.name: Hermetic Seal
hermetic_seal.description: A high-performance carbon seal, able to withstand both the harsh interstellar environment and the rigours of intensive, high-energy industrial use. User is advised to regularly check seal integrity after installation.
sources: Available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

herox.name: Herox
herox.description: Herox is a tradeable that can be crafted, found in containers or purchased.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.
Can be received after analysing Glowing Mineral
Can be salvaged from destroyed pirate ships.

hex_core.name: Hex Core
hex_core.description: This strange energy orb constantly vibrates, emitting a low-frequency drone. Slight variations in the pattern repeat over and over, almost as if it is attempting to relay a message.
sources: 2 Hex Cores rewarded for killing Anomalous fauna on specific planets with exotic biome.
Can be received from an Anomaly Iteration as a gift.
Randomly from Black Market Vendor.

hexite.name: Hexite
hexite.description: An odourless, mineral-rich substance with a hexagonal crystalline structure, harvested from the faecal matter of a creature.
sources: During the Starbirth mission, a set amount of Hexite is awarded at a nearby (marked) crashed freighter, for use in creating the Consciousness Bridge.
Due to the random generation of rewards, guild NPCs can hand out several hundred units of Hexite.
Can be obtained in small amounts by killing the Crystal Elementals on Shard-type Exotic planets.
Can be purchased directly from vendors at pirate-controlled Space Stations.
Exceptionally rarely awarded from Nexus missions and Frigate expeditions.

holographic_analyser.name: Holographic Analyser
holographic_analyser.description: A temporary frigate upgrade that lasts for one expedition. This powerful analytic computer overclocks the existing fleet systems, allowing for faster-than-light calculations. Heat is a problem, and the chips do not last long.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Can be obtained as a mission reward.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.

hot_ice.name: Hot Ice
hot_ice.description: A paradoxical material, made less mysterious by its relative ease of manufacture.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Can be obtained as a mission reward.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.

hydraulic_wiring.name: Hydraulic Wiring
hydraulic_wiring.description: Specialist wiring and control threads, this flexible material allows the transmission of power and signals, as well as offering direct manipulation of remote components. Used in the creation of a wide range of advanced technologies.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Available from some Technology Merchants for 5000+ units

hydrothermal_fuel_cell.name: Hydrothermal Fuel Cell
hydrothermal_fuel_cell.description: A high thermal energy fuel, contained within a standardised fuel cell. Used to fuel the Humboldt Drive that powers the Nautilon submarine. Created with a mix of organic compounds (Carbon and cyto-phosphates) and localised mineral salts.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

hypnotic_eye.name: Hypnotic Eye
hypnotic_eye.description: The eye is cold, almost frozen, to the touch. Nonetheless, it is impossible to escape the feeling it is somehow still alive. Extended exposure is not recommended. Do not stare back into the eye. Do not stare back. Do not stare back.
sources: Hypnotic Eye drops when an Abyssal Horror is killed. It will disappear if not picked up within a few seconds of spawning.
These can be found in Derelict Freighter containers.

indium.name: Indium
indium.description: A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets. Indium is found on planets orbiting blue stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
sources: It can be found on planets orbiting blue stars.

ion_battery.name: Ion Battery
ion_battery.description: Convenient and optimised power storage unit. Used in a wide variety of defensive and hazard protection systems. Constructed by fusing Ferrite Dust with underground Cobalt. Frequently found ready-made in cylindrical metal containers.
sources: Can always be bought from any Galactic Trade Terminal or from pilot NPCs on Space Stations (only on 'Goods Availability->Abundant' setting).

ionised_cobalt.name: Ionised Cobalt
ionised_cobalt.description: A highly energised form of Cobalt, this processed metal can be used to create Advanced Ion Batteries, a conveniently portable source of energy for the Exosuit. In widespread use as a key component in the creation of advanced technologies and structures.
sources: Available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

iridesite.name: Iridesite
iridesite.description: Advanced light metal alloy traded throughout the galactic Outer Edge. Often used in the interiors of trading shuttles to reduce weight as they ascend from planets with high gravitational fields.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.
Can be received after analysing Glowing Mineral.

kelp_sac.name: Kelp Sac
kelp_sac.description: A rubbery, luminescent sac harvested from underwater Candle Kelp plants. Agricultural science has not yet tamed the Candle Kelp. As such, these sacs cannot be farmed.
sources: It can be harvested from Candle Kelp that can be found underwater, but it is advisable to get into interaction range of the plants, as they can replenish the exosuit's oxygen supply.

On the Galactic Map it is indicated with Water if the star system has a body of water. This information is not indicated on planetary scans, however the water on the surface is visible to the naked eye from space.

korvax_casing.name: Korvax Casing
korvax_casing.description: The metallic shell of a disconnected electronic lifeform that was too distant from its own kind to be refreshed with a new entity. Highly prized by all species, not least its own.
sources: Simplest way to get this in large amounts is to buy it from pilot NPCs in any Trading Post found in Korvax systems.
Can be found in Damaged Containers or as monolith rewards.
A possible reward from frigate expeditions.
A possible trade from wandering traders you encounter while using the Pulse Engine.
With a 10% chance from crew lockers in Derelict Freighters.

larval_core.name: Larval Core
larval_core.description: A pulsating jellied orb, this gooey sphere is warm to the touch. Its stench triggers a primal fear in mortal beings, a deep-seated gnawing that begs you to drop it and flee.
sources: Drops when a Whispering Egg is destroyed. It will disappear if not picked up within a few seconds of spawning.

lemmium.name: Lemmium
lemmium.description: Pure Ferrite alloy. Crafted from Pure Ferrite and Uranium. Used extensively in starship freighter construction due to its sheer strength. A hardcore material popular on the Galactic Trade Network.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.
Can be received after analysing Glowing Mineral
It can also be salvaged from destroyed pirate ships and chests on planets.

life_support_gel.name: Life Support Gel
life_support_gel.description: Emergency life support fuel. Synthesised from rocket fuel crystals and carbon, this gel offers a temporary boost to Life Support systems. Long-term impact on a user's lungs is currently unknown.
sources: Can always be bought from any Galactic Trade Terminal or from pilot NPCs on Space Stations (only on 'Goods Availability->Abundant' setting).

living_glass.name: Living Glass
living_glass.description: An advanced building material, this glass has been imbued with organic compounds that allow it to react to the environment. Microbes within the glass filter harmful light of all wavelengths and balance the atmosphere as required.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

living_pearl.name: Living Pearl
living_pearl.description: Born in the hearts of enormous glowing molluscs found deep underwater. Unlike most pearls, this sample is no unliving calcite. Some trace of the mother-clam's consciousness remains within the gem, giving it a lingering, haunting beauty.
sources: It can be found in Armoured Clams. Damage will force them to open their shells for a short time, revealing the Living Pearl inside.
If it is not taken in the allotted time, the shells will close and the player needs to damage them again.

living_slime.name: Living Slime
living_slime.description: A heavy, oozing slime. It is moving gently, as if it has a heartbeat of its own. Nutrient source: unknown.
sources: Can be purchased and sold at Galactic Trade Terminals and NPCs for a profit.
Found in alien-infested Derelict Freighters.
Sometimes dropped when killing fauna on Exotic planets.
Damaged Machinery.

liquid_explosive.name: Liquid Explosive
liquid_explosive.description: A general purpose high explosive, offered in liquid form for convenience of transport and deployment. Do not drink.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

lubricant.name: Lubricant
lubricant.description: A synthetic lubricant that reduces wear and prolongs the lifespan of technologies with moving parts.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

magnetic_resonator.name: Magnetic Resonator
magnetic_resonator.description: An electromagnetic frequency oscillator, able to function in a wide-range of conditions thanks to both ferrous and non-ferrous magnetic properties. Used in the creation of a wide range of advanced technologies.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Available from some Technology Merchants for 5000+ units

magnetised_ferrite.name: Magnetised Ferrite
magnetised_ferrite.description: Highly processed metal, requiring several stages of processing in a Refiner. Used in the creation of advanced structures and technologies. Avoid ingestion.
sources: From resource cans dropped by defeated pirates.
In Resource Deposits.
Collectable by boarding any player-owned industrial Frigate that is not on an expedition.
Also available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

magno_gold.name: Magno-Gold
magno_gold.description: Highly prized and lustrous alloy. Popular with traders of all known primary galactic races. Crafted from Ionised Cobalt and Phosphorus. Easily recognisable by its bright red glow and strong magnetic field.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.
Can be received after analysing Glowing Mineral.

marrow_bulb.name: Marrow Bulb
marrow_bulb.description: A glowing organic bulb, harvested from the Cave Marrow plant found growing underground. The Cave Marrow has proved resistant to domestication, and no farmable cultivars are known to exist. As such, marrow bulbs must be harvested by hand in the wild.
sources: It can be harvested from Cave Marrows that can be found in caves.

metal_plating.name: Metal Plating
metal_plating.description: A lightweight metal product, heavily used in the manufacture of starship parts and deployable technology. A mainstay of the construction industries of all known primary species. Crafted from Ferrite Dust.
sources: Available from any Galactic Trade Terminal.

microprocessor.name: Microprocessor
microprocessor.description: A compact, low-heat microchip. Assembled from processed Chromatic Metal, created from one of several specialised terrain metals. Used in the creation of a wide range of advanced technologies.
sources: Blueprint can be awarded in the Scientific Research mission, found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

mind_arc.name: Mind Arc
mind_arc.description: A strange piece of technology, a gift from beyond the stars. It shimmers in a way that suggests it is not fully in this world.

mind_control_device.name: Mind Control Device
mind_control_device.description: A temporary frigate upgrade that lasts for one expedition. The mind control device plugs into the ship's trading and communications systems, allowing the Fleet Commander to gain the upper hand in any negotiation.
sources: The product's blueprint is a possible reward from a Manufacturing Facility or Operations Centre.
The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for one Salvaged Frigate Module.
Possible drop from Sentinel starships.

mineral_compressor.name: Mineral Compressor
mineral_compressor.description: A temporary frigate upgrade that lasts for one expedition. The mineral compressor allows fleet mining crews to liquidise the substances they extract, for both faster processing and easier transportation.
sources: The product's blueprint is a possible reward from a Manufacturing Facility or Operations Centre.
The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for one Salvaged Frigate Module.

modified_quanta.name: Modified Quanta
modified_quanta.description: This one-of-a-kind Atlas Seed holds an aesthetically pleasing mathematical construct salvaged from the simulation of an alternate reality.
sources: The blueprint is given after talking to an Atlas Interface. Milestone Viking or above is required.

mordite.name: Mordite
mordite.description: Despite much study, little is known about this haunting, crystalline compound. It is released from the cadavers of dying creatures, but can also be specifically cultivated and harvested from the Mordite Root plant.
sources: It can be recovered from killing fauna in the game.
It can be harvested from Mordite Root (yields 25 every eight hours of real time).
It can also be found in 'Organic' Rocks.
It can be found in Mineral Deposits on Marsh planets.

mordite_root.name: Mordite Root
mordite_root.description: An inedible tuber that produces a small yield of Mordite crystals. A peaceful alternative to the process of harvesting Mordite from the corpses of creatures. Mordite Root must be grown in a Hydroponics Tray. Approximate growing time: 8 hours

nipnip.name: NipNip
nipnip.description: This medicinal herb is known for its pungent buds, which are harvested to produce Gek Nip. NipNip thrives in dank environments, and often grows as a weed. Suitable for hydroponic planting indoors. Needs a tropical or humid climate before planting outdoors.

nipnip_buds.name: NipNip Buds
nipnip_buds.description: A pungent bud harvested from the NipNip plant, often used to produce GekNip.
sources: The primary source is harvesting.
Can be purchased in outlaw systems.
Can be occasionally bought from Scrap Dealers on space stations.
Can be found in Derelict Freighter containers.
Can occasionally be given as a reward for Nexus missions.
Can occasionally be purchased on planets from black market traders for nanites.
Can occasionally be purchased on planets from landed ships.
It is a possible reward from frigate expeditions.

nitrogen.name: Nitrogen
nitrogen.description: A reactive atmospheric gas found wherever there is organic life. Nitrogen is readily harvested from the atmospheres of Lush and Toxic planets.
sources: As a secondary element in some flora.
From Atmosphere Harvesters built on planets with Lush and Toxic biomes.
Using Gas Extractor at a Nitrogen Concentrated Gas Cloud on Toxic or Lush biomes.
It can be found at Resource Depots.

nitrogen_salt.name: Nitrogen Salt
nitrogen_salt.description: A refined product, this is a powerful organic fertiliser in an easily distributed form.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Can be found in planetary depots.
Can be obtained as a mission reward.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.
Can be purchased from NPCs in some Minor Settlements.

noospheric_orb.name: Noospheric Orb
noospheric_orb.description: An Atlas Seed capable of resonating on humanoid telepathic frequencies; may attempt to subsume any subordinate intellect in close proximity.
sources: The blueprint is given after talking to an Atlas Interface. Milestone Rosetta or above is required.

novae_reclaiment.name: Novae Reclaiment
novae_reclaiment.description: Atlas Seed contains neutronium elements from a catastrophic supernova event that obliterated a sentient civilization in an earlier era.
sources: The blueprint is given after talking to an Atlas Interface. Milestone Hubble or above is required.

organic_catalyst.name: Organic Catalyst
organic_catalyst.description: A catalytic material used in the creation of many organic fertilizers.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Can be obtained as a mission reward.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.

oxygen.name: Oxygen
oxygen.description: Integral to the atmospheric filtering technology at the heart of the exosuit life support system. Exosuit material processing allows oxygen to be harvested directly from appropriate planetary flora. Other plantlife may be scanned with the Analysis Visor to reveal alternative oxygen supplies.
sources: Can be harvested from red plants in the wild.
Can be found as a secondary element in some flora.
Can be found as a primary element in Underground Toxic Hazard.
Can always be bought from any Galactic Trade Terminal or from pilot NPCs on Space Stations (only on 'Goods Availability->Abundant' setting).
Obtained from an Oxygen Harvester.
Obtained from an Atmosphere Harvester on exotic planets.
Using Gas Extractor at an Oxygen Concentrated Gas Cloud.

paraffinium.name: Paraffinium
paraffinium.description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common materials after inspection with an Analysis Visor. Typically found on planets with a tropical environment.
sources: As a secondary element in some minerals or in Resource Deposits on planets with Lush biomes.
From Hotspot on planets with Lush biomes.
Also available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

phosphorus.name: Phosphorus
phosphorus.description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an Analysis Visor. Typically found on planets with a scorched environment.
sources: As a secondary element in some minerals or in Resource Deposits or Hotspots on planets with Scorched biomes.
Found in Hotspots on Mega Exotic planets located in red stellar systems.
Also available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

photic_jade.name: Photic Jade
photic_jade.description: This irreplaceable Atlas Seed is a form of matter-adapted photons coalesced into physical solidity by unknown means.
sources: The blueprint is given after talking to an Atlas Interface. Milestone Dawn or above is required.

platinum.name: Platinum
platinum.description: Extremely valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically mined from asteroids. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits. Universally prized for its hardiness and versatility.
sources: Can be bought from some Galactic Trade Terminals or Ship Traders.
Can be mined from crystalline/amorphous asteroids.
As a secondary element in some minerals in caves.
By destroying freighter cargo.

poly_fibre.name: Poly Fibre
poly_fibre.description: A connective fibre for electronics, made from an advanced synthetic polymer and capable of serving as a conduit for power and data.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

portable_reactor.name: Portable Reactor
portable_reactor.description: A miniature self-controlled nuclear reactor. Generates sub-stellar levels of energy in a hassle-free, widely compatible fuel module.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

projectile_ammunition.name: Projectile Ammunition
projectile_ammunition.description: Advanced munition fragments, constructed to fit Universal Multi-Tool Standard 07/FF1. Easily inserted into the Boltcaster, Pulse Spitter and Scatter Blaster via the Multi-Tool clip reloading system.

pugneum.name: Pugneum
pugneum.description: This oily, unsettling liquid leaks from the circuitry of Sentinels. Prized by the Vy'keen, Pugneum is thought to share some essential properties with Nanites. It hums in a sinister fashion upon contact with organic matter.
sources: Drops from destroyed Sentinels; the received amount depends on what type of sentinel is destroyed, see more information here.
Also available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

pure_ferrite.name: Pure Ferrite
pure_ferrite.description: Processed metal, free of dust and pebbles. Used to construct a wide variety of structures and technologies. Typically purified from Ferrite dust using a Refiner, but can occasionally be found in large deposits. Collection may require an Advanced Mining Laser.
sources: As a primary or secondary element in some minerals. These minerals usually require Advanced Mining Laser to harvest.
Also available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

pyrite.name: Pyrite
pyrite.description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common materials after inspection with an Analysis Visor. Typically found on planets with a desert environment.
sources: As a secondary element in some minerals or in Resource Deposits or Hotspots on planets with Barren biomes.
Also available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

quad_servo.name: Quad Servo
quad_servo.description: A highly sprung motor arm salvaged from inside of a Sentinel patrol unit. It occasionally twitches, as if experiencing the echo of combat.
sources: Can be obtained by destroying the Combat Supplies containers dropped by Sentinel Quads.
Can be found in Suspicious Packet (Goods) from the Scrap Dealer.
Can be a gift from Guild Envoys of the Mercenaries Guild.

quantum_computer.name: Quantum Computer
quantum_computer.description: An extremely fast advanced processing unit. Allows real-time solving of otherwise impossible calculations. However, protection against decoherence is not guaranteed. Used in the creation of a wide range of advanced technologies.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Available from some Technology Merchants for 5000+ units.

quantum_processor.name: Quantum Processor
quantum_processor.description: A highly advanced computational device, essential for the complex calculations involved in warp travel.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

radon.name: Radon
radon.description: A colourless, odourless gas with a relatively short half-life. Found in both Radioactive and Frozen atmospheres, this gas is produced by the decay of other high-energy elements.
sources: As a secondary element in some flora.
From Atmosphere Harvesters built on planets with Irradiated or Frozen biomes.
Using Gas Extractor at a Radon Concentrated Gas Cloud.
It can be found at Resource Depots.

residual_goop.name: Residual Goop
residual_goop.description: A pulsating, foul smelling goop that builds up in poorly-maintained machinery. Skin contact is not advised.
sources: Every Abandoned Building has a termnial and interacting with it allows the player to either discard the Residual Goop or move it to the exosuit inventory. After that the terminal can be used. Each terminal can contain up to 200 Residual Goop.
Residual Goop can be purchased from some Galactic Trade Terminals and pilot NPCs.

runaway_mould.name: Runaway Mould
runaway_mould.description: An out of control mould growth that builds up in poorly-maintained machinery. Likely to be several different species of mould, merged together into one super-colony.
sources: This item can be received as a gift from the Guild representatives in space stations.
Runaway Mould can be purchased and sold at Galactic Trade Terminals and NPCs for a profit.
This item can be received from encrypted missions at the Nexus.
This item can also be obtained from Curious Deposits on some planets, appearing as a sphere that rolls when mined.

rusted_metal.name: Rusted Metal
rusted_metal.description: Handfulls of corroded metal, distorted by years of exposure to the harsh environment. Handle with care.
sources: Upon opening a Damaged Container, a GUI will pop up with an option to either discard or keep some Rusted Metal. Each container can contain between 50 and 100 Rusted Metal. Once the Rusted Metal is either discarded or moved to your inventory, the Damaged Container will open and you can receive a reward.
Rusted Metal can be purchased from some Galactic Trade Terminals and pilot NPCs.
Rusted Metal is a rare planetary resource to be mined akin to Ferrite and its variants. Seen on Dead Worlds.

sac_venom.name: Sac Venom
sac_venom.description: Stabilized poison sample initially produced by aquatic urchin creatures. A rare and expensive item on the Galactic Trade Network.
sources: Sac Venom can be found by destroying urchin-like creatures found on planetary surfaces and under the water. Like other high value non-stackable trading commodities, some planets have an abundance of these.
With assistance from a Farmer, Sac Venom also be grown as a product of the Venom Urchin plant, with a harvest time of 3 hours 20 minutes.

salt.name: Salt
salt.description: A naturally occuring salt, found in abundance in underwater minerals. Can be processed in a Refiner to create Chlorine. This refined form is used in the manufacture of advanced products and technologies.
sources: As a secondary element in some minerals.
Primary element in most underwater minerals.
In Resource Deposits.
Also available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

silicate_powder.name: Silicate Powder
silicate_powder.description: An abundant mineral element, found within the geological strata of all rocky worlds. Easily extracted using a Terrain Manipulator. Create a tunnel anywhere to begin extraction. Process in a Refiner to create Glass.
sources: It can be mined from soil using the Terrain Manipulator.

silver.name: Silver
silver.description: Valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically mined from asteroids. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits. Prized by people in all systems for its lustre and shine.
sources: Can be mined from asteroids.
Can be found in Resource Deposits.
As a secondary element in some minerals in caves.
Also available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

semiconductor.name: Semiconductor
semiconductor.description: An advanced material useful in many electronic devices, with its own in-built temperature regulator. Crafted from Thermic Condensate and Nitrogen Salt.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Can be obtained as a mission reward.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.
Can be purchased from NPCs in some Minor Settlements.

sodium.name: Sodium
sodium.description: A powerful catalyst, useful for charging defensive technologies such as shields or hazard protection. Exosuit material handling technology allows automatic harvesting from appropriate sodium-rich flora. A vital ingredient in the creation of many advanced devices, products and components.
sources: From yellow flowers visible on the Scanner.
As a secondary element in some minerals.
In Resource Deposits.
Can always be bought from any Galactic Trade Terminal or from pilot NPCs on Space Stations (only on 'Goods Availability->Abundant' setting).

sodium_nitrate.name: Sodium Nitrate
sodium_nitrate.description: An advanced catalyst, useful for charging defensive technologies such as shields or hazard protection. Created in a Refiner, or occasionally found in crystalline form on a planet's surface. Offers a substantially improved energy-per-gram ratio over regular Sodium.
sources: In yellow crystal minerals located on nearly every planet. These minerals require an Advanced Mining Laser and are visible on the Scanner.
Also available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

solanium.name: Solanium
solanium.description: A powerful chemical that has resisted attempts at synthesis. It can be harvested from the bark of the Solar Vine. The vine requires a hot climate to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.
sources: This element can be harvested from wild plants, but requires the use of Haz-Mat Gauntlet.
It can also be found mixed with carbon in carbon-based plants or trees. For easy discovery, scan the surrounding flora with the Analysis Visor.

With assistance from a Farmer, Solanium can be grown as a product of the Solar Vine plant, providing a base yield of 50 with a harvest time of 16 hours. It requires the use of Haz-Mat Gauntlet to safely harvest.

solar_mirror.name: Solar Mirror
solar_mirror.description: A specialist optical component. Employing an impossibly polished surface, this mirror is able to selectively filter different wavelengths of light, changing its reflective pattern based on nearby magnetic fields. Used in the creation of a wide range of advanced technologies.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Available from some Technology Merchants for 5000+ units.

solar_vine.name: Solar Vine
solar_vine.description: This 'living rock' is adapted to live in the extreme heat of scorched biomes. However, it can be farmed in most environments and, once established, yields a moderate harvest. Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Ensure Hot climate before planting outdoors. Approximate growing time: 16 hours

soul_engine.name: Soul Engine
soul_engine.description: A powerful organic computing unit. A glitching beat drives this miracle circuit, performing cycle after cycle in an endless, furious loop of calculation.
sources: The blueprint is acquired from -null- during The First Traveller mission.

star_bramble.name: Star Bramble
star_bramble.description: A medium-sized, farmable plant that yields an occasional harvest of valuable Star Bulbs. Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Ensure Lush climate before planting outdoors. Approximate growing time: 4 hours

star_bulb.name: Star Bulb
star_bulb.description: A beautiful gemstone, this prized product is the engorged, luminescent berry of the Star Bramble. The host plant requires lush conditions to thrive in the wild but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponic Tray.
sources: This element can be harvested from wild plants, but requires the use of Haz-Mat Gauntlet.
It can also be found mixed with carbon in carbon-based plants or trees. For easy discovery, scan the surrounding flora with the Analysis Visor.
With assistance from a Farmer, Star Bulbs can also be grown as a product of Star Bramble with a harvest time of approximately 4 hours and yielding 25 Star Bulbs.

stasis_device.name: Stasis Device
stasis_device.description: A device specifically crafted to keep lifeforms alive for thousands of years longer than their natural lifespan. Such a device requires great skill to manufacture, as not only is it technically complex, but the consequences for a user in the event of malfunction would be disastrous.
sources: The blueprint can be acquired from Manufacturing Facilites or purchased from the Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.

state_phasure.name: State Phasure
state_phasure.description: For unknown reasons, this unique Atlas Seed has been phased out of alignment with this quantum reality. Contents cannot be determined.
sources: The blueprint is given after talking to an Atlas Interface. Milestone Curiosity or above is required.

sulphurine.name: Sulphurine
sulphurine.description: A pungent atmospheric gas. High concentrations are extremely hazardous to organic life. With the aid of specialised machinery, can be extracted from the atmospheres of Scorched and Desert planets.
sources: As a secondary element in some flora
From Atmosphere Harvesters built on planets with Scorched or Barren biomes
Using Gas Extractor at a Sulphurine Concentrated Gas Cloud
Raiding some Resource Depots
From certain Mutant Plant resource nodes

superconductor.name: Superconductor
superconductor.description: An advanced conductive material, the superconductor further enriches the field-warping power of the Semiconductor.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Can be obtained as a mission reward.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.

tainted_metal.name: Tainted Metal
tainted_metal.description: Shredded fragments of a soft, grey metal. Its surface is porous, and when touched it oozes ever-so-slightly. Found in the creaking wreck of a derelict freighter. The space station Scrap Dealer may find this interesting...
sources: Resource found in Derelict Freighter space encounter.
Received from Scrap Dealer and Guild Envoy in exchange for Crew Manifest and Captain's Log.

thermic_condensate.name: Thermic Condensate
thermic_condensate.description: A refined product, holding the energy potential of heated atmospheric gas in a stable state until required.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Can be found in planetary depots.
Can be obtained as a mission reward.
Can be obtained from Frigate expeditions.

tritium.name: Tritium
tritium.description: Radioactive isotope commonly used to fuel the fusion reactor at the heart of starship Pulse Engines. Abundant in interstellar asteroid fields, Tritium can be mined from asteroids using starship weaponry.
sources: Can be mined from asteroids.
Found in crystalised form as a Tritium Hypercluster.
Can be found in some Galactic Trade Terminals.
Can be found in a Freighter after purchasing one.

unstable_gel.name: Unstable Gel
unstable_gel.description: A highly reactive gel, this substance is both energy-rich and dangerous to touch.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Sometimes awarded for opening Crashed Freighter's Cargo Pods.

unstable_plasma.name: Unstable Plasma
unstable_plasma.description: Densely-packed fuel capsule for use in the Plasma Launcher. Contained highly-pressurised electro-thermal energy for use in land disruption grenade technology.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Also available from any Galactic Trade Terminal.

uranium.name: Uranium
uranium.description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an Analysis Visor. Typically found on planets with a radioactive environment.
sources: As a secondary element in some minerals or Hotspots on planets with Irradiated biomes.
Can be found in Metal 'Fingers.'
Also available from some Galactic Trade Terminals.

venom_urchin.name: Venom Urchin
venom_urchin.description: A small, innocuous looking plant whose leaves periodically secrete a small amount of potent Sac Venom, a valuable trading commodity. Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Cannot be planted outdoors. Approximate growing time: 3 hours 20 mins

viscous_fluids.name: Viscous Fluids
viscous_fluids.description: An unnaturally thick liquid of dubious colour. Its origins are impossible to fathom. Appears to have some mild magnetic properties.
sources: Viscous Fluids can be purchased and sold at Galactic Trade Terminals and NPCs for a profit.
Viscous Fluid frequently appears as a removed item to repair Damaged Machinery.

void_egg.name: Void Egg
void_egg.description: An anomalous egg. The shell is tough and leathery, and twitches when touched. A faint tapping can be heard within. From time to time, it appears to sing.
sources: The Void Egg can be purchased from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion for 3200 Quicksilver.
A decorative only version can also be found randomly on Infested Planets.

vortex_cube.name: Vortex Cube
vortex_cube.description: An ancient object, unearthed from the depths of a planetary cave system. Its surface is cold to the touch, and is curiously polished despite its age. A fusion of metal and rock, these cubes have proved resistant to industrial processing. As such, they are of value only to collectors. Can be sold at a Galactic Trade Terminal.
sources: It can be found in and around caves on certain planets.

vykeen_dagger.name: Vy'keen Dagger
vykeen_dagger.description: Largely ceremonial weapon. A vital part of Vy'keen tradition and culture.
sources: It can be found in Damaged Containers or as monolith rewards.
It can also be bought from NPCs in Trading Posts.
It is a possible reward from frigate expeditions.
It is also a possible trade from wandering traders you encounter while using the Pulse Engine.
It can also be salvaged from containers on a Derelict Freighter
It is a possible reward from NPCs at Space Stations for practicing language skills well.

vykeen_effigy.name: Vy'keen Effigy
vykeen_effigy.description: A small wooden icon carved into the shape of a Sentinel drone. Used by warriors to enter a temporary trance-like state that eliminates their kind's need for sleep.
sources: It can be found in Damaged Containers or as monolith rewards.
It can also be bought from NPCs in Trading Posts.
It is a possible reward from frigate expeditions.
It is also a possible trade from wandering traders you encounter while using the Pulse Engine.

vykeen_tablet.name: Vy'keen Tablet
vykeen_tablet.description: A stone tablet bearing line after line of intricate runes. The words are unintelligible, an ancient dialect forgotten by all but the oldest of the Vy'keen elders. The hand that carved this stone must have been extraordinary. The stonework is precise, delicate - and yet perfectly conveys the unyielding aggression its writer clearly possessed.
sources: A quest item in the main storyline to show a Vy'keen cartographer that you are worthy to receive information about the Vy'keen's history.

walker_brain.name: Walker Brain
walker_brain.description: Shifting nanite clusters sewn together with a pugneum filament, this circuit is painfully hot to the touch. A sinister purple light leaks from deep within its wiring, changing in intensity as it watches its holder.
sources: Loot from a Sentinel Walker
Mercenaries Guild Envoy
Suspicious Packet (Goods)
Mission Board missions
Nexus missions

warp_cell.name: Warp Cell
warp_cell.description: This antimatter-based fuel is one of the few power sources capable of meeting the incredible energy requirements of a starship hyperdrive. Secured within a robust housing, the cell is guaranteed paradox-free during FTL travel.
sources: Warp Cells can be found by locating an Atlas Interface or The Atlas; inside you'll sometimes find two Warp Cells near to the interaction area.

warp_hypercore.name: Warp Hypercore
warp_hypercore.description: A high-capacity antimatter-based fuel, this cell harnesses an internal black hole generator to power starship hyperdrives across multiple warp jumps. Cell walls are specially designed to reflect any reality paradoxes back towards the heart of the unit, where they generate additional power.
sources: Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250 Nanites.
Occasionally shows up as a reward for a Nexus mission.
Can be awarded by Guild Envoys.

wiring_loom.name: Wiring Loom
wiring_loom.description: A prefabricated circuit board, designed for flexible use in a large range of technology components. The module features an integrated nanite processor, allowing it to be quickly configured for a wide variety of uses.
sources: Can be purchased at a Galactic Trade Terminal in any star base for about double of the announced value (50-55K units).
Can be dismantled from Obsolete Technology or most Upgrade Modules.
Can be purchased from technologists in outposts for around 75000 units.
